ride.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to sit on an animal, especially a horse, and make it move along
ride.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: She learned to ride when she was seven.
He was riding a large grey mare.
She arrived riding on a white horse.
He rode away across the marshes.
ride.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to travel on a bicycle or motorbike
ride.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: He had never learned to ride a bicycle.
They mounted their bikes and rode off.
ride.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to travel in a bus, car, or other vehicle that you are not driving
ride.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: We got onto the bus and rode into San Francisco.
Ann rides the bus to work.
The kids were riding in the back.
ride.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to travel up or down in a lift
ride.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: He rode the elevator down to the first floor.
I rode up to the tenth floor.
ride.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to be floating in water or in the air
ride.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The smaller boat was lighter and rode higher in the water.
The moon was riding high in the sky.
There was a large ship riding at anchor in the bay.
ride.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: to float on a wave and move forward with it
ride.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: to annoy someone by often criticizing them or asking them to do things
ride.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: Why are you riding her so hard?
ride.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a journey in a vehicle, when you are not driving
ride.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Can you give me a ride back to town?
Sammy had promised to take me for a ride in his truck.
I managed to get a ride down to the station.
We hitched a ride (=got a free ride from a passing vehicle) into town.
A fifteen minute taxi ride will take you to the airport.
The new model offers a lovely smooth, comfortable ride.
He invited me to go for a ride in his new car.
ride.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a journey on a bicycle, a horse, or a similar animal
ride.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Shall we go for a bike ride this afternoon?
Can I have a ride on your bike?
ride.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a large machine that people ride on for fun at a fair
ride.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: We went on loads of rides.
ride.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: a path for riding on a horse in the countryside
ride.translation[1].note_box[0].sections: Visitors can take a ride on a steam train.
He went for a ride in a private plane piloted by a friend.
Ellie gave us a ride to school.
I left the farm that night, and got a ride into town.
He hitched a ride to Denver on a truck.
Hugh took me for a ride in his new car.
The resort is a short bus ride away from the hotel.
I climbed slowly aboard the bus for the long ride to Hawkesworth.
The new suspension produces a smoother ride.
Part of the flight had been a bumpy ride through a thunderstorm.
ride.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to be very successful or confident
ride.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Investors are riding high at the moment.
ride.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to be doing something unwise that could result in failure
ride.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Are junk bond buyers riding for a fall?
ride.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: to get an advantage for yourself without doing anything to earn it
ride.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: Rival firms sometimes free ride on each other’s research and development.
ride.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: used to say how easy or difficult a process or period of time is for someone
ride.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: It won’t be an easy ride for the retailer.
Hungarian investors have been having a bumpy ride (=a difficult time) recently.
ride.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: if someone gets a free ride, they get an advantage without having to work for it
ride.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: They’re getting a free ride at the taxpayer’s expense.
ride.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: to trick someone, often in order to get money from them
ride.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: Some auto dealers are taking car buyers for a ride by charging inflated prices on extended warranties.
